overview: From 2025-06-15 to 2025-06-22, elizaos/elizaos.github.io had 2 new PRs (4 merged), 2 new issues, and 12 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Move wallet address fetching to pipelines instead of NextJS build
topIssues.author: META-DREAMER
topIssues.body:
The new caching logic for fetching wallet addresses isnt ideal because its fetching from github during the NextJS build instead of in the Pipelines workflow where all the other github data fetching happens.

Should update frontend build so it only queries the database for wallet addresses, and move the logic for fetching wallet addresses from github into the ingest pipeline. Additionally, githubService.ts should be deprecated in favour of the github.ts class that already exists.

topIssues.title: update docs
topIssues.author: madjin
topIssues.body: mention we have to explicitly say that any code that is fetching data from github / external APIs and storing in the database should only ever run in the pipelines

topPRs.title: feat: Add gold checkmark icon for linked wallets
topPRs.author: madjin
topPRs.body:
This commit introduces a gold checkmark icon next to the username on your user profile page for users who have linked their Ethereum or Solana wallets.

Key changes:
- Added a new `GoldCheckmarkIcon.tsx` component to display an SVG checkmark.
- Modified `UserProfile.tsx` to:
    - Fetch wallet information using the existing `getUserWalletData` function.
    - Conditionally display the `GoldCheckmarkIcon` next to the username if a wallet address (`ethAddress` or `solAddress`) is present.
    - Wrap the icon with a `Tooltip` component that shows "Wallet linked" on hover.
- Ensured the icon is styled appropriately using Tailwind CSS and aligns correctly with the username.

The icon provides a clear visual indicator of wallet verification, enhancing user trust and information clarity on the profile page. I confirmed correct functionality through manual code review and scenario simulation.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Introduced support for linking multiple blockchain wallets (e.g., Ethereum, Solana) to user profiles, with a unified system for managing and displaying linked wallets.
  - Added visual indicators (badges and tooltips) for users with linked wallets on profile and leaderboard pages.
  - Implemented robust wallet address validation and chain support logic.

- **Enhancements**
  - Improved leaderboard and profile displays to show all linked wallets, replacing previous Ethereum/Solana-only handling.
  - Streamlined wallet data retrieval and caching for faster, more reliable updates.
  - Expanded documentation with detailed guides on pipelines, workflows, and wallet linking.

- **Database Changes**
  - Added a new table for wallet addresses and updated the users table to track wallet data updates.
  - Updated database schema and migration scripts to support wallet linking features.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Improved error handling and logging for wallet data retrieval and processing.

- **Chores**
  - Updated dependencies and refined internal workflows for data pipelines and deployment.
  - Refactored and removed obsolete code and hooks related to wallet linking.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: feat: update repoconfig
topPRs.author: madjin
topPRs.body:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/00cfa68c-24b9-4fca-a89f-9ac8ce228a22)

1. **Configuration Updates**:
   - Modified `config/pipeline.config.ts` to support multiple repositories with a new structure that includes `owner`, `name`, and `defaultBranch` for each repository

2. **Pipeline System Enhancements**:
   - Updated the pipeline system to handle multiple repositories through the `getSelectedRepositories` step
   - Modified core pipeline components (ingest, process, export, summarize) to iterate over configured repositories
   - Added repository-specific data segregation in storage paths (e.g., `data/<owner_repo>/`)

3. **Documentation and Planning**:
   - Created `plan/multi-repo.md` outlining the multi-repository support strategy
   - Added `plan/tasks.md` with detailed implementation tasks for the multi-repo feature

4. **Pipeline Configuration Types**:
   - Updated `src/lib/pipelines/pipelineConfig.ts` with new schema definitions for repository configuration
   - Added validation and transformation logic for repository configurations

---

Reasons

1. **Scalability**: The system needed to expand beyond a single repository to support both the main `elizaos` organization and its plugins ecosystem, requiring a more flexible configuration structure.

2. **Data Organization**: Each repository's data needs to be properly segregated to maintain clear boundaries and prevent cross-contamination, while still allowing for organization-wide analytics.

3. **Future-Proofing**: The changes establish a foundation for adding more repositories and organizations in the future, with proper configuration validation and data handling patterns in place.

These changes follow the system's existing patterns (as seen in the pipeline rules) while extending its capabilities to handle multiple repositories in a maintainable way.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Added support for tracking and displaying multiple repositories, including new metadata fields for repository owner and name.
  - Enhanced configuration to specify repositories using separate owner and name fields.

- **Database**
  - Updated the database schema to include owner and name columns for repositories.
  - Added a new migration and schema snapshot reflecting the expanded repository metadata.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Improved robustness of database migrations and worktree management during data synchronization.

- **Documentation**
  - Introduced planning and task documents outlining multi-repository support and implementation phases.

- **Chores**
  - Added environment variable to limit the number of users generated in certain workflows.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: feat: wallet_addresses table with CAIP-2/10 adoption
topPRs.author: Dangoz
topPRs.body:
#### Based on feedback from #124, this PR targets several issues as following:
- Remove the fetching logic from client component UserProfile.tsx, and refactor it to fetch/synchronize server-side during build time at src/app/profile/queries.ts.
- Remove ethAddress & sol Address from users table. Create a new table called wallet_addresses and adjust database access logic for the new table.
- Adopt Chain Identifier based on [CAIP-2](https://github.com/ChainAgnostic/CAIPs/blob/master/CAIPs/caip-2.md). ChainId instead of Chain name are saved to the database.

topPRs.title: Remove githubService, update github.ts class to replace it.
topPRs.author: META-DREAMER
topPRs.body:
Closes #130 

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Added a new pipeline step to ingest wallet addresses for users, with tracking of successful and failed ingestions.
  - Introduced a function to retrieve user wallet data from the database.

- **Improvements**
  - Enhanced GitHub API integration with strong typing, validation, and expanded repository and file management capabilities.
  - Refactored wallet data ingestion for more explicit handling of GitHub repository existence and improved cache logic.
  - Updated pipeline context creation to require explicit GitHub token and structured options.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Updated wallet data retrieval in leaderboard and profile pages for improved accuracy.

- **Chores**
  - Adjusted database migration and restore workflows, including migration journal file handling and cleanup steps.
  - Removed redundant or obsolete workflow steps related to database migrations.

- **Refactor**
  - Consolidated and streamlined GitHub API services, removing legacy wallet linking service files.
  - Updated pipeline types to support chaining additional steps.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: Improve data syncing setup to properly handle migrations
topPRs.author: META-DREAMER
topPRs.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **Documentation**
  - Added comprehensive documentation for GitHub Actions workflows, data pipeline architecture, and development workflow in `.github/README.md` and expanded `CLAUDE.md` with detailed operational guides and architecture overviews.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Improved reliability and error handling in GitHub Actions for data synchronization and deployment workflows.
  - Simplified and clarified the database restore process in GitHub Actions and CLI scripts.

- **Refactor**
  - Streamlined migration logic to support partial migrations and removed unnecessary worktree handling.
  - Refactored migration scripts to enable targeted migration execution and improved metadata handling.

- **Chores**
  - Updated workflow triggers and job conditions to ensure accurate deployment and checks.
  - Removed redundant initialization steps in PR check workflows.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

Opened issue #5124 for Eliza Postman JSON updates and participated in discussions with 4 issue comments and 2 PR comments, while also providing 1 approval review.

Contributed a total of +1448/-1001 lines across 77 files while also approving 2 code reviews.

Actively participated in code reviews with 7 reviews and maintained consistent daily activity across the week, balancing bug fixes (55%) with feature development (40%). Currently has an open PR (#5205) focused on fixing unit and integration tests.

Maintained very consistent activity across 5 days, contributing over 1,400 lines of code while addressing a diverse set of UI and functionality issues, particularly in media handling, environment settings, and agent interactions.
